intro: Hieracium panamense, commonly known as the Panama hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and ragworts. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in a composite head, and its leaves are usually lance-shaped with hairy surfaces. Hieracium panamense is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, where it thrives in humid conditions.
